# Chord: Major 7th in C# (Shape: E)

## Description:
The Major 7th chord in C# is built using the notes C# (root), E# (major 3rd), G# (perfect 5th), and B# (major 7th), utilizing the shape of an E major chord. This chord has a rich and sophisticated sound due to the inclusion of the major 7th interval.

## Notes and Intervals:
- C# (Root)
- E# (Major 3rd)
- G# (Perfect 5th)
- B# (Major 7th)

## Musical Flavor:
The Major 7th chord in C# exudes a dreamy, jazzy, and introspective quality. It is often used in jazz, R&B, and soul music to add a touch of elegance and complexity to a progression. This chord can create a sense of longing or contemplation in a musical piece.

## Genre:
The Major 7th chord in C# is commonly found in genres such as jazz, R&B, soul, and neo-soul. Its smooth and expressive sound fits well in these genres where emotional depth and sophistication are valued.
